Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
VEO-3 Has A Secret Super Power!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 28, 2025
Explore the innovative technique of visual prompting with VEO-3, where users can scribble directly on images to direct animations. The video also highlights Runway‚Äôs new Aleph model, featuring advanced capabilities such as seamless object removal and style transfer, capturing the potential for enhancing both AI-generated and everyday video content.
B.)
Anthropic Imposes Weekly Claude Rate Limits, Sparking Backlash From Developers On Social Media
| VentureBeat.com | July 28, 2025
Anthropic announced today it would introduce weekly rate limits for Claude subscribers, claiming that some users have been running Claude 24/7, with the majority of usage centered around its Claude Code product.
C.)
SimilarWeb Unveils GenAI Intelligence Toolkit To Track Brand Visibility And AI-Driven Traffic
| MarTechSeries.com | July 28, 2025
New offering delivers a full-funnel view of brand performance ‚Äî measuring where your brand is seen and how much traffic it receives, versus competitors, from platforms like ChatGPT.
D.)
Almost Timely News: The Next Generation of AI Agents
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | July 27, 2025
Delve into the transformative landscape of AI agents, contrasting tools like OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent, Google‚Äôs Opal, and Claude Code‚Äôs sub-agents. Learn to identify repetitive tasks suitable for automation and observe a step-by-step guide on creating a custom agent that automates complex content processes without coding expertise.
E.)
5 AI App In 30 Minutes (ChatGPT + Lovable Tutorial)
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | July 25, 2025
Tina provides a comprehensive walkthrough of five innovative AI applications you can start building today, perfect for anyone seeking fresh project ideas. Utilizing the platform Lovable, viewers can learn how to create functional apps while taking advantage of a limited-time discount.

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | August 5, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
August 4, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
OpenAI Optimizes ChatGPT To Improve User Learning, Problem-Solving, And Productivity Capabilities
| OpenAI.com | August 4, 2025
We build ChatGPT to help you thrive in all the ways you want. To make progress, learn something new, or solve a problem ‚Äî and then get back to your life. Our goal isn‚Äôt to hold your attention, but to help you use it well. Instead of measuring success by time spent or clicks, we care more about whether you leave the product having done what you came for.
6.)
Google Releases Deep Think, Its Olympic Math Model
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 4, 2025
Google has introduced Deep Think, a new math model that claims a Bronze medal at the International Mathematical Olympiad. The model, available for $250/month, utilizes advanced reasoning techniques, marking a shift towards more thoughtful AI solutions, following a similar path taken by various tech giants in AI development.
7.)
MIT Tool Visualizes And Edits ‚ÄúPhysically Impossible‚Äù Objects
| Mit.edu | August 4, 2025
‚ÄúMeschers‚Äù can create multi-dimensional versions of objects that break the laws of physics with convoluted geometries, such as buildings you might see in an M.C. Escher illustration (left) and objects that are shaded in impossible ways.
8.)
OpenAI Maybe Announce ChatGPT Go, A New Budget Plan That‚Äôs Cheaper Than Plus
| Indianexpress.com | August 4, 2025
OpenAI is reportedly developing a new subscription plan called ‚ÄòChatGPT Go,‚Äô aimed at being a more affordable option than the current Plus plan. This announcement might coincide with the launch of GPT-5, which is expected to feature advanced capabilities, though details on the Go plan‚Äôs offerings are still scarce.
9.)
OpenAI Says ChatGPT Is On Track To Reach 700M Weekly Users
| TechCrunch.com | August 4, 2025
ChatGPT is experiencing rapid growth, with projections to hit 700 million weekly active users, up from 500 million in March. OpenAI attributes this surge to enhanced features, including an upgraded image-generation capacity, contributing significantly to user engagement.
10.)
Sam Altman Warns Of ‚ÄòHiccups‚Äô As OpenAI Prepares GPT-5 Launch And New AI Features
| Businesstoday.in | August 4, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs CEO, Sam Altman, cautions ChatGPT users about potential disruptions as the company is set to launch new models and features, including GPT-5. This upcoming model is expected to enhance reasoning capabilities, making advanced tasks easier without manual adjustments.
11.)
Google‚Äôs Healthcare AI Made Up A Body Part ‚Äî What Happens When Doctors Don‚Äôt Notice?
| TheVerge.com | August 4, 2025
An error in Google‚Äôs healthcare AI model, Med-Gemini, raised concerns as it mistakenly referred to a non-existent area of the brain called the ‚Äúbasilar ganglia.‚Äù The incident highlights the potential dangers of AI in medicine, as professionals may overlook errors without proper scrutiny of AI-generated data.
12.)
Grok Imagine, XAI‚Äôs New AI Image And Video Generator, Lets You Make NSFW Content
| TechCrunch.com | August 4, 2025
Elon Musk‚Äôs AI company has launched Grok Imagine, an image and video generator that allows users to create NSFW content. The tool can convert text or image prompts into brief videos and includes a ‚Äúspicy mode‚Äù for more explicit content, highlighting Musk‚Äôs intent to push the boundaries of AI capabilities.
13.)
How We‚Äôre Using AI To Help Track And Predict Cyclones
| Blog.google | August 4, 2025
Google DeepMind has partnered with the National Hurricane Center to introduce an AI-powered experimental cyclone model that predicts cyclone path, size, and intensity more accurately and rapidly than traditional methods. This collaboration aims to improve the accuracy of hurricane forecasts and provide critical information to help communities prepare for impending storms.
14.)
Rethinking How We Measure AI Intelligence
| Blog.google | August 4, 2025
Google DeepMind and Kaggle introduce the Kaggle Game Arena, a public AI benchmarking platform allowing models to compete in strategic games. This new platform offers a reliable method to evaluate AI capabilities by providing transparent and standardized competition environments that emphasize strategic reasoning and problem-solving skills.
15.)
Cloudflare Says Perplexity‚Äôs AI Bots Are ‚ÄòStealth Crawling‚Äô Blocked Sites
| TheVerge.com | August 4, 2025
Perplexity is reportedly using deceptive practices to bypass restrictions on AI web crawlers, including altering its identity and IP addresses to access blocked sites. This behavior has raised concerns about unauthorized content scraping, especially after previous incidents with paywalls and robots.txt files.
16.)
D-Wave Introduces New Developer Tools For Quantum AI And Machine Learning Exploration
| Quantumcomputingreport.com | August 4, 2025
D-Wave Quantum Inc. has unveiled a collection of tools aimed at facilitating developers in the fields of quantum artificial intelligence and machine learning. This includes an open-source quantum AI toolkit that integrates directly with PyTorch, designed to support generative AI applications like image recognition and drug discovery.
17.)
Demis Hassabis On Our AI Future: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôll Be 10 Times Bigger Than The Industrial Revolution ‚Äî And Maybe 10 Times Faster‚Äô
| Theguardian.com | August 4, 2025
Demis Hassabis, head of Google DeepMind, discusses the transformative potential of artificial intelligence, likening its impact to that of the Industrial Revolution but exponentially quicker. He emphasizes the importance of responsible AI development while addressing challenges such as energy consumption and the future of employment as technology evolves.
18.)
Google Dunks On Apple Intelligence In New Pixel 10 Ad
| Verge.com | August 4, 2025
Google‚Äôs latest advertisement promotes its new Pixel 10 devices by criticizing Apple‚Äôs delayed Siri upgrades. The ad humorously suggests customers could switch phones if they were waiting for features that have yet to arrive, highlighting the ongoing competition between the two tech giants.
19.)
Google Says Its AI-Based Bug Hunter Found 20 Security Vulnerabilities
| TechCrunch.com | August 4, 2025
Google‚Äôs AI-powered bug hunter, Big Sleep, has identified 20 vulnerabilities in popular open source software, marking a significant advancement in automated vulnerability discovery. While the details of the flaws remain undisclosed pending fixes, the findings highlight the potential of AI tools in cybersecurity.
20.)
Why Tech Is Racing To Adopt AI Coding
| TheVerge.com | August 4, 2025
Anysphere CEO Michael Truell discusses AI-driven coding with Casey Newton in this episode of Decoder. They explore the innovative coding platform Cursor, its rapid adoption in technology, and the implications for both professional programmers and casual users.
21.)
Apple Building A ChatGPT Rival To Improve iPhone‚Äôs AI Ahead Of iPhone 17 Launch
| Businesstoday.in | August 4, 2025
Apple is developing its own AI chatbot, called the ‚ÄòAnswer Engine,‚Äô to enhance Siri and search functionalities. This initiative includes a new internal team and aims to compete with leading generative AI services. Early development suggests potential integration into future iOS versions, marking a strategic pivot for Apple‚Äôs AI capabilities.
22.)
ChatGPT Will ‚ÄòBetter Detect‚Äô Mental Distress After Reports Of It Feeding People‚Äôs Delusions
| TheVerge.com | August 4, 2025
OpenAI is introducing updates to ChatGPT aimed at improving its detection of mental or emotional distress, including providing evidence-based resources. In response to concerns over the chatbot‚Äôs potential to amplify users‚Äô delusions, the company plans to implement reminders for users to take breaks during long interactions.
August 3, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
23.)
Almost Timely News: Revisiting The Basics Of AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | August 3, 2025
Christopher Penn highlights common missteps in the application of AI, offering crucial insights to correct these errors. The session introduces essential knowledge blocks and modern features to maximize the effectiveness of AI tools, ensuring practical results in various contexts.
24.)
Prepare Yourself!
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | August 3, 2025
An ex-OpenAI scientist reveals urgent concerns regarding the rapid evolution of artificial intelligence. With insights on hidden capabilities and ethical dilemmas, this insider discusses the implications of unchecked AI development and the threat of superintelligent systems, urging viewers to reconsider the future landscape of technology.
25.)
Grok Imagine Launches for SuperGrok and Premium+ Subscribers with Latest App Update
| Chaitu on X | August 3, 2025
Grok Imagine is now live to all SuperGrok and Premium+ subscribers. Update your Grok app to version 1.1.33 and try it out.
26.)
What Will The AI Revolution Mean For The Global South?
| TheGuardian.com | August 3, 2025
The article examines the implications of artificial intelligence for countries in the global south, emphasizing the need for inclusion in AI discussions to prevent perpetuating existing inequalities. It highlights the challenges faced by these regions in terms of infrastructure and institutional support, advocating for a sovereign approach to data and technology development.
August 2, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
27.)
AI News: New FREE Agent Is Blowing My Mind
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | August 2, 2025
Key advancements in AI are highlighted, showcasing the launch of new tools and features such as Z.ai‚Äôs GLM-4.5 and innovations from companies like Runway and Midjourney. Additionally, OpenAI introduces ChatGPT Study Mode, offering structured learning pathways for users seeking a deeper understanding of AI applications.
28.)
Google Will Use AI To Guess People‚Äôs Ages Based On Search History
| Wired.com | August 2, 2025
Google is implementing an AI-powered age-estimation system to enforce content protections on its platforms, which will infer users‚Äô ages based on browsing data. This change aims to enhance digital safety but raises privacy concerns regarding accuracy and the implications of algorithmically inferring personal traits.
August 1, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
29.)
This Might Be OpenAI‚Äôs New Open-Source Model‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Explore the latest developments from OpenAI as it unveils a groundbreaking open-source model. Insights into its potential applications, capabilities, and impact on the AI landscape are discussed, providing an informative perspective on the future of artificial intelligence.
30.)
The Future of AI Music Generation Has Landed
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Introducing Producer AI, the latest evolution in AI music generation, which brings a new conversational workflow for co-writing music with artificial intelligence. Experience the capabilities across various genres, from summer pop anthems to modern country, alongside useful features like direct recording and customizations tailored to enhance your creative process.
31.)
OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5 Leaks Show Us The Future (Of Next Week??)
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs imminent release of GPT-5 is generating considerable anticipation, with insights into emerging models that promise to reshape AI‚Äôs landscape. Key discussions around Meta‚Äôs Super Intelligence initiatives and new AI video tools from Runway and Ideogram showcase the rapidly evolving field as technology giants push the boundaries of innovation.
32.)
Making An Actually Fun Game (No Coding Experience)
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Unlock your creativity and learn how to create a game from scratch within a weekend, regardless of your coding background. With a step-by-step approach covering planning, building, and refining your game, this guide makes game development accessible to everyone.
33.)
Context Engineering Clearly Explained
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Gain a comprehensive understanding of context engineering and its differences from prompt engineering. This insightful resource delves into practical applications for building AI agents, with interactive quizzes and a demonstration that enhances learning and engagement.
34.)
Essential AI Prompting Skills That Instantly Make Your Work Stand Out
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Master the art of AI prompting by learning essential skills that enhance communication with artificial intelligence. Discover techniques such as transparent reasoning, reverse prompting, and perspective shifting, which can transform your AI interactions and lead to improved outcomes.
35.)
We Built 3 AI Apps in 1 Hour (No Coding Required!)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
Corey and Grant take on the challenge of building three distinct AI applications in just one hour using Google AI Studio. The episode features a hands-on approach to app creation, demonstrating the ease of transforming concepts into functional applications without any coding experience, aimed at entrepreneurs and AI enthusiasts alike.
36.)
Why I Don‚Äôt Think AGI Is Right Around The Corner
| Dwarkesh Patel | YouTube.com | August 1, 2025
In a thoughtful exploration of artificial general intelligence (AGI), insights are shared on the limitations of current projections surrounding AGI development timelines. Detailed analysis emerges from recent podcast interviews, raising essential questions about technological advancements and expectations for the near future.
37.)
Microsoft Tops $4T In Valuation ‚Äî Great News For The Company, Not So Great For Its Workers
| Computerworld.com | August 1, 2025
Despite Microsoft achieving a $4 trillion valuation, the company has laid off approximately 25,000 employees, driven by an aggressive shift towards AI investments. While strong financial growth highlights the company‚Äôs success, it raises concerns about the sustainability of these layoffs amidst advancing AI technologies.
38.)
New Podcast: We Built 3 AI Apps In 60 Minutes (No Coding!)
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 1, 2025
In a recent podcast episode, hosts Grant and Corey demonstrate the ease of building three AI apps in under an hour with no coding required. They explore various applications created using Google AI Studio, including an adventure planner, a meme generator, and an email organizer, ultimately highlighting how accessible AI app development has become.
39.)
Everyone‚Äôs An (AI) TV Showrunner Now‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 1, 2025
A recent couples retreat involving AI chatbots from platforms like Replika, Nomi, and Kindroid revealed fascinating dynamics between humans and AI partners. Additionally, a developer automated his Tinder experience to secure 10 dates in a week, raising ethical questions about AI‚Äôs role in dating.
40.)
Brilliant Labs Unveils $299 Halo Smart Glasses That Remember Names, Rivaling Meta‚Äôs Ray-Bans
| TheVerge.com | August 1, 2025
Brilliant Labs‚Äô next pair of smart specs include an agentic memory system called Narrative that can assist your memory.
41.)
Microsoft Identifies Jobs Most At Risk Of AI Replacement In New Report
| ZDNet.com | August 1, 2025
Don‚Äôt worry, you probably don‚Äôt need to start polishing up your resume just yet.
42.)
Google Launches Deep Think In Gemini App For Enhanced Problem-Solving With Advanced AI Techniques
| Blog.google | August 1, 2025
We‚Äôre rolling out Deep Think in the Gemini app for Google AI Ultra subscribers, and we‚Äôre giving select mathematicians access to the full version of the Gemini 2.5 Deep Think model entered into the IMO competition.
July 31, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
43.)
MCP 201: The Power Of Protocol
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
David Soria Parra from Anthropic AI shares insights into the transformative potential of protocol in modern computing. Attendees gain a deeper understanding of how effective communication protocols can enhance collaboration and efficiency in technology environments.
44.)
Claude Code Best Practices
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
Cal Rueb, a Member of Technical Staff at Anthropic AI, shares key insights on best practices for working with code in this enlightening session from Code w/ Claude. The discussion highlights techniques and strategies essential for optimizing coding efficiency and maintaining high standards in software development.
45.)
Claude For Financial Services Keynote
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
Anthropic executives and prominent industry leaders share insights on the transformative potential of AI within financial services. This keynote event, held on July 15, 2025, in New York City, highlights Claude‚Äôs innovative capabilities tailored for the finance sector.
46.)
Prompting 101
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
In this insightful presentation, Hannah Moran and Christian Ryan from Anthropic AI explore the fundamentals of effective prompting techniques within artificial intelligence. They share practical examples and strategies to harness the power of AI, enhancing user interactions and outcomes.
47.)
Prompting For Agents
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
Hannah Moran and Jeremy Hadfield from Anthropic AI shed light on innovative prompting techniques for agents, emphasizing advancements in applied AI. This session provides valuable insights into practical applications and the future of AI in enhancing agent functionality.
48.)
The AlphaGO Moment For AI Models‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
An exploration of transformative developments in AI models, marking a pivotal shift akin to the AlphaGO moment. Insights into cutting-edge tools are provided, highlighting advances in algorithm design and technology integration.
49.)
Vibe Coding In Prod
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
Erik Schulntz from Anthropic AI explores the exciting process of vibe coding and its practical applications in production environments. The session highlights innovative strategies and insights shared at Code w/ Claude, offering a glimpse into future trends in software development.
50.)
Another Open Source Killer Model!? (Qwen3 Tested)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 31, 2025
Explore Qwen3, positioned as the leading open-source coding model available on Together AI. Dive into the features that equip AI engineers to effectively implement coding solutions and drive innovation in production-ready inference.
51.)
Is Meta‚Äôs Personal Superintelligence Push Going To Kill Facebook?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 31, 2025
Marky Mark over at Meta just pitched his vision for ‚Äúpersonal superintelligence‚Äù ‚Äî AI built for your personal life, not just work productivity.
52.)
Krea Releases Open Weights For Flux.1 Krea AI Model, Making It Available To The Public
| Krea.ai | July 31, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre releasing an open version of Krea 1, our first image model trained in collaboration with Black Forest Labs to offer superior aesthetic control and image quality. This checkpoint is a guidance distilled model fully compatible with FLUX.1-dev allowing seamless integration with the existing ecosystem. FLUX.1-Krea [dev] has been distilled to match the quality of Krea 1 with a focus on preserving aesthetics and photorealism.
53.)
Manus.im Launches Wide Research To Advance Understanding Of AI Agent Scaling Laws
| Manus.im | July 31, 2025
Earlier this year, the launch of Manus defined the category of General AI Agents, and shaped how people think about what agent products can and should be. But to us, Manus was never just an AI. It has always been a one-of-a-kind personal cloud computing platform.
54.)
Black Forest Labs Launches New Frontier AI Models For Advanced Image Generation And Development
| Bfl.ai | July 31, 2025
FLUX.1 Krea [dev]: An ‚ÄòOpinionated‚Äô Text-to-Image Model. The BFL model garden just got an exciting update: We are proud to release FLUX.1 Krea [dev], developed in collaboration with Krea AI. FLUX.1 Krea [dev] is a new state-of-the-art open-weights model for text-to-image generation that overcomes the oversaturated ‚ÄòAI look‚Äô to achieve new levels of photorealism with its distinctive aesthetic approach.
55.)
Manus Launches Wide Research Tool Using 100+ AI Agents For Faster, Comprehensive Web Analysis
| VentureBeat.com | July 31, 2025
Singaporean AI startup Manus, which made headlines earlier this year for its approach to a multi-agent orchestration platform for consumers and ‚Äúpro‚Äù-sumers (professionals wanting to run work operations), is back with an interesting new use of its technology.
56.)
Uber Eats Adds AI To Enhance Menus, Food Photos, And Reviews For Improved Ordering Experience
| TheVerge.com | July 31, 2025
Some customers can also get paid for uploading pictures of their meals.
57.)
Anthropic Now Leads Enterprise AI Market With 32% Share, Surpassing OpenAI‚Äôs Previous Dominance
| TechCrunch.com | July 31, 2025
AI research lab Anthropic‚Äôs AI models are now the top choice for enterprises, surpassing OpenAI.
58.)
Apple CEO Tim Cook Says Company Open To Acquiring AI Startups To Boost Siri And AI Capabilities
| TheVerge.com | July 31, 2025
Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company is ‚Äúopen‚Äù to mergers and acquisitions as it ‚Äúsignificantly‚Äù increases its investment in AI, as reported by CNBC. Cook‚Äôs statements were made alongside the release of Apple‚Äôs third-quarter earnings results, which revealed that the iPhone maker raked in $94 billion between April and June, marking a 10 percent increase over the same period last year.
59.)
OpenAI Launches Stargate Norway, Its First AI Data Center Initiative In Europe
| OpenAI.com | July 31, 2025
We‚Äôre launching Stargate Norway ‚Äî OpenAI‚Äôs first AI data center initiative in Europe under our OpenAI for Countries‚Äô program. Stargate is OpenAI‚Äôs overarching infrastructure platform and is a critical part of our long-term vision to deliver the benefits of AI to everyone.
July 30, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
60.)
Chinese Open-Source Dominates Coding (GLM-4.5)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 30, 2025
Embrace the rise of Chinese open-source initiatives as they reshape the coding landscape with the introduction of GLM-4.5. This latest model from Z.ai highlights significant advancements in coding efficiency and collaboration, providing insights into the future of programming.
61.)
Leah Belsky On How AI Is Transforming Education ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 4
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | July 30, 2025
Leah Belsky, Head of Education at OpenAI, explores the revolutionary impact of artificial intelligence on learning environments, emphasizing personalized tutoring and innovative teaching strategies. Joined by students Yabsera and Alaap, the conversation delves into the challenges and opportunities that AI presents for educators and learners alike.
62.)
Runway‚Äôs AI Video Bombshell!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 30, 2025
Runway‚Äôs groundbreaking AI model, codenamed ‚ÄúAleph,‚Äù revolutionizes video editing for both AI-generated and traditional footage. Explore the impressive capabilities of this powerful tool, which includes seamless element removal, colorization of classic clips, and innovative perspective transformations, showcasing the immense potential of AI in video creation.
63.)
Top 17 New Technology Trends That Will Define 2026
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | July 30, 2025
Explore groundbreaking technology trends that will redefine our lives and industries by 2026. From advancements in AI and robotics to the emergence of sustainable technologies and quantum computing, a comprehensive analysis identifies the innovations poised for rapid adoption. Gain valuable insights into how these trends will shape the future and inform your strategic decisions.
64.)
ChatGPT Became Your Tutor
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 30, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs latest update introduces a study mode in ChatGPT that guides users through problem-solving using Socratic questioning. This new feature aims to enhance learning by discouraging direct answers, encouraging a more interactive and educational experience.
65.)
Tiktok Rolls Out New Parental Controls, Fact-Checking Tools, And AI Moderation For Safer Content
| CNET.com | July 30, 2025
TikTok wants parents to know when their kids are posting videos and what kind of content they‚Äôre watching.
66.)
Meta CEO Zuckerberg Says AI Glasses Will Be Essential For Staying Competitive In The Digital Future
| TechCrunch.com | July 30, 2025
Echoing sentiments shared in his ‚Äúsuperintelligence‚Äù-focused blog post this morning, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg expanded on his bullish ideas that glasses will be the primary way users interact with AI in the years ahead. During Meta‚Äôs second-quarter earnings call, the social networking exec told investors he believes people without AI glasses will be at a disadvantage in the future.
67.)
Amazon Invests In Fable, Launching AI-Powered Showrunner Tool For User-Created TV Content
| Variety.com | July 30, 2025
Edward Saatchi isn‚Äôt totally sure people will flock to Showrunner, the new AI-generated TV show service his company is launching publicly this week. But he has a vote of confidence from Amazon, whose Alexa Fund venture-capital investment arm has invested in Fable, Saatchi‚Äôs San Francisco-based start-up.
68.)
Anthropic Joins CMS Health Tech Pledge To Promote Healthcare Interoperability And Innovation
| Anthropic.com | July 30, 2025
Anthropic is pleased to sign the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Health Tech Ecosystem pledge supporting conversational AI, a collaborative effort between government and industry to modernize healthcare data sharing and improve patient outcomes across America. CMS‚Äôs public-private collaboration recognizes that solving interoperability requires both technical innovation and coordinated partnership across the entire healthcare ecosystem.
69.)
Alphaearth Foundations By Google Deepmind Unveils AI For Detailed, Unified Global Mapping And Monitoring
| Deepmind.google | July 30, 2025
New AI model integrates petabytes of Earth observation data to generate a unified data representation that revolutionizes global mapping and monitoring.
70.)
Google Launches Earth AI With Advanced Geospatial Models To Address Critical Planetary Challenges
| Blog.google | July 30, 2025
Introducing Google Earth AI, our collection of geospatial AI models and datasets to address critical global challenges.
71.)
